title: Klondike Gold Rush - Seattle Unit National Historical Park: Temporary Exhibits
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Temporary Exhibits              Temporary Exhibits         The park service celebrates its centennial in 2016! Explore what being a park ranger is like through this interactive exhibit.      A Century of Service The history of National Park Rangers through November 2016   Our newest exhibit highlights the NPS Centennial and park service history through the eyes of the park ranger. Visitors are invited to join the Find Your Park adventure at the trailhead and follow a career of green and grayâ€”learning about 100 years of service along the way.   This exhibit was designed by Klondike-Seattle staff and University of Washington museology graduate students. It specifically highlights regional parks, with rotating artifacts on display from regional parks throughout the duration of the exhibit.   Learn more about the NPS Centennial at findyourpark.com                  A Century of Service: The National Park Service Story   4 Photos  Images from the park's newest exhibit highlighting National Park Service history through the eyes of the park ranger.
